info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:12AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Berks, Lehigh, Carbon, Monroe and northwestern Northampton Counties through 245 AM EDT... At 212 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Schnecksville, or 10 miles northwest of Allentown, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Lehighton, Mount Pocono, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Palmerton, Kutztown, Jim Thorpe, Slatington, Pen Argyl, Nesquehoning, Wind Gap, Bath, Weatherly, Walnutport, Topton, Stormville, Neffs and Werry Lake. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 55 and 97. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 41 and 55. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 314. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
